summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney and Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney regarding DOJ representatives planning to meet with Maxwell at MDC without her counsel present, and issues with delayed discovery delivery. The attorney demands no contact without counsel and expedited delivery of a hard drive containing discovery materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Client of attorney Christian Everdell, incarcerated at MDC, awaiting discovery materials for her defense.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell, emailing AUSA about DOJ visit and discovery delay.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Cc'd on email from Christian Everdell, likely part of Maxwell's legal team at Cohen & Gresser.

persons.context: Cc'd on email from Christian Everdell, likely part of Maxwell's legal team.

connections.description: Everdell is Maxwell's defense attorney, communicating on her behalf regarding DOJ visit and discovery issues.

events.title: Planned DOJ visit to Maxwell at MDC
events.description: DOJ representatives planned to meet with Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), prompting her attorney to object due to lack of counsel presence.

events.title: Replacement hard drive sent
events.description: Prosecution sent a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials to Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Discovery deadline
events.description: Deadline for completion of the initial tranche of discovery in Maxwell's case, which was missed.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney, Christian Everdell, objected to DOJ representatives meeting with Maxwell at MDC without her counsel present.
Maxwell had not received a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials, delaying her ability to review evidence for her defense.
The discovery deadline of August 21, 2020, had been missed by over two weeks at the time of the email.
The email highlights tensions between Maxwell's defense team and prosecutors regarding access to discovery and client communications.
Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) as of September 2020.
